Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (15 ll.) and names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Undertaking by two brothers not to interfere with a neighbour in building a house, under a penalty. Date. year 6 Phamenoth 12 of Ptolemy Philometor = BC. 175 April 15". Nos. 10575-10601 from the Siut Archive.
Curator's comments: Published: A. F. Shore and H. S. Smith 'Two Unpublished Demotic Documents from the Asyut Archive'. JEA 465 (1959), 52-60.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.168, no.4) (cited with translation of a short passage)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2740) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2740)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss, fractured Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Displayed in Room 63 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
